BR_text.BRsummary: Example SSD prepare dataset toos are incompatible with im2rec in MxNet 1.1
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
 
 example/ssd/tool prepare_pascal.sh and prepare_dataset.py are incompatible with im2rec arg options in Apache MxNet version 1.1
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment info (Required)</denchmark-h>
 
 MxNet version 1.1
 Deep Learning AMI with Source Code Ubuntu v5.0 (ami-173bd86a)
 What to do:
 
 Run the script example/ssd/toosl/prepare_pascal.sh and you will see errors
 
 Here are suggested fixes:
 diff tools/prepare_pascal.sh tools.orig/prepare_pascal.sh
 <denchmark-code>22c22
 < python $DIR/prepare_dataset.py --dataset pascal --year 2007 --set test --target $DIR/../data/val.lst --no-shuffle
 ---
 > python $DIR/prepare_dataset.py --dataset pascal --year 2007 --set test --target $DIR/../data/val.lst --shuffle False
 </denchmark-code>
 
 diff tools/prepare_dataset.py tools.orig/prepare_dataset.py
 <denchmark-code>105c105
 <     parser.add_argument('--no-shuffle', dest='shuffle', default='True', help='shuffle list',
 ---
 >     parser.add_argument('--no-shuffle', dest='shuffle', help='shuffle list',
 125,134c125,128
 <     if args.shuffle:
 <     	subprocess.check_call(["python",
 <        		os.path.join(curr_path, "../../../tools/im2rec.py"),
 <        		os.path.abspath(args.target), os.path.abspath(args.root_path),
 <        		"--pack-label"])
 <     else:
 <     	subprocess.check_call(["python",
 <        		os.path.join(curr_path, "../../../tools/im2rec.py"),
 <        		os.path.abspath(args.target), os.path.abspath(args.root_path),
 <        		"--no-shuffle", "--pack-label"])
 ---
 >     subprocess.check_call(["python",
 >         os.path.join(curr_path, "../../../tools/im2rec.py"),
 >         os.path.abspath(args.target), os.path.abspath(args.root_path),
 >         "--shuffle", str(int(args.shuffle)), "--pack-label", "1"])
 </denchmark-code>

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajayvohra2005>@ajayvohra2005</denchmark-link>
  the fix has been merged into master, please consider closing the issue, thanks!
